document.heading: Safe Streets Anti-Prostitution Temporary Amendment Act of 1995

history.narrative: Law 11-77, the “Safe Streets Anti-Prostitution Temporary Amendment Act of 1995”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 11-422. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on July 29, 1995, and October 10, 1995, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on October 26, 1995, it was assigned Act No. 11-147 and transmitted to both Housed of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 11-77 became effective on January 24, 1996.
